newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - Cobleskill-Richmondville CSD, NY.

text.p: SUMMARY NOTICE OF BOND SALE
COBLESKILL-RICHMONDVILLE CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT SCHOHARIE,
OTSEGO AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES, NEW YORK
GENERAL OBLIGATION SCHOOL DISTRICT (SERIAL) BONDS, 1997
(BOOK-ENTRY-ONLY) (BANK QUALIFIED)
SEALED PROPOSALS will be received and considered by the President of the Board of Education of Cobleskill-

Richmondville Central School District, Schoharie, Otsego and Montgomery Counties, New York at the offices of Chase Investment Services Corp., Fixed Income Department, 21st Floor, One Chase Square, Rochester, New York 14643, until
11:00 A.M., Prevailing Time, on
Tuesday, January 7, 1997

at which time and place the bids will be opened, for the purchase IN FEDERAL FUNDS at not less than par and accrued interest of $4,700,000 School District (Serial) Bonds, 1997, (the "Bonds"), maturing (without option of prior redemption) on June 15 of each year as follows:
MATURITIES
The Bonds will be dated January 15, 1997 and will bear interest payable semi annually on June 15 and December 15 of each year commencing June 15, 1997.

The Bonds will be awarded to the bidder offering to purchase the Bonds at such rate or rates of interest as will produce the lowest net interest cost in accordance with the terms set forth in the Notice of Sale.
The School District will designate the Bonds as "qualified tax-exempt obligations" pursuant to Section 265(b)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.

The Bonds will be issued by means of a book-entry-only system with The Depository Trust Company, New York, New York, which will act as securities depository for the Bonds. The School District will furnish the Bonds and the approving legal opinion of Hodgson, Russ, Andrews, Woods & Goodyear, LLP, Albany, New York, on or about January 28, 1997.

The School District reserves the right to change the time and/or date for the opening of bids. Notice of any such change shall be provided not less than 48 hours prior to the time set forth above for the opening of bids by means of a supplemental notice of sale to be transmitted over The Munifacts Wire.
Requests for copies of the Notice of Sale herein
summarized and the Official Statement relating to the Bonds
and such other information as the State Comptroller prescribe by rule or order may be directed to Bernard P. Donegan, Inc., PO Box 70, Victor, New York 14564; Phone
Dated: December 24, 1996 Edward J.
Zuchorski, Jr.
Cobleskill, New York President, Board of Education
(From The Bond Buyer)
